gui.runesword.air.sword.major: Major: Grants speed boost on kill.
gui.runesword.air.sword.majorenchant2: Efficiency: Chance to get speed II.
gui.runesword.air.sword.majorenchant3: Feather Falling: Chance to get Jump Boost.
gui.runesword.air.sword.minor: Minor: Chance to knock up enemies when attacking.
gui.runesword.blood.obtain: Obtain: Low drop chance from all mobs.
gui.runesword.blood.sword.major: Major: Attacks cost health, but deal more damage.
gui.runesword.blood.sword.majorenchant1: Protection: Chance to not drain your health when attacking.
gui.runesword.blood.sword.minor: Minor: Chance to heal on kill.
gui.runesword.blood.sword.minorenchant1: Fire Aspect: More lifesteal if enemy on fire.
gui.runesword.blood.sword.minorenchant2: Aqua Affinity: More lifesteal if in water.
gui.runesword.blood.sword.minorenchant3: Mending: chance to repair sword on attack.
gui.runesword.earth.obtain: Obtain: Found in treasure chests underground.
gui.runesword.earth.sword.major: Major: The sword deals more damage while you are underground.
gui.runesword.earth.sword.minor: Minor: Mobs have a chance to drop ores on kill.
gui.runesword.earth.sword.minorenchant2: Looting: Chance that enemy drops rare ore.
gui.runesword.earth.sword.minorenchant3: Fire Aspect: Chance to smelt ore immediately.
gui.runesword.enchantingtext: Like other tools, runes can be enchanted in an enchanting table to boost the effect of the runes. Some enchantments increase the power of the major effect, while some enchantments increase the power of the minor effect. You can read about the different possible enchantments for every type of rune in their respective guide chapter.
gui.runesword.fire.sword.major: Major: The sword deals more damage if the user is on fire.
gui.runesword.fire.sword.majorenchant2: Fire Protection: Chance to block fire damage.
gui.runesword.fire.sword.minor: Minor: Chance to put ground on fire when attacking mob.
gui.runesword.fire.sword.minorenchant2: Power: Chance to create lava instead of fire.
gui.runesword.fire.sword.minorenchant3: Mending: Repair sword if hit burning mob.
gui.runesword.frost.obtain: Obtain: Created by crafting Air and Water Rune together.
gui.runesword.frost.sword.major: Major: Chance to summon Frost Golem when killing enemies.
gui.runesword.frost.sword.majorenchant1: Fortune: Increase Frost Golem spawn chance.
gui.runesword.frost.sword.majorenchant3: Efficiency: Frost Golem can shoot Frostballs.
gui.runesword.frost.sword.minor: Minor: Chance to shoot slowing Frostball when attacking.
gui.runesword.intro: Welcome to the Runesword guide, containing all the information you need to become proficient in runeforging! Click on one of the icons above to learn more about a specific subject.
gui.runesword.magic.obtain: Obtain: Created by crafting all elemental runes (water, fire, air and earth) together with a blood rune.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.major: Major: Activate to fire a magic projectile.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minor: Minor: Boosts the major effect depending on enchantments.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant1: Aqua Affinity: Increase projectile damage underwater.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant10: Flame: Chance to apply fire on projectile hit.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant11: Fortune: Chance to deal double damage.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant12: Frost Walker: Projectile leaves trail of snow.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant13: Impaling: Increase projectile damage against underwater mobs.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant16: Looting: More experience dropped when killing mobs.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant17: Loyalty: Chance for projectile to boomerang back.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant18: Luck of the Sea: Temporary underwater breathing when launching projectile.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant19: Lure: Pull in nearby enemies at projectile impact.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant2: Bane of Arthropods: Increase projectile damage against arthropod mobs.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant20: Mending: Chance to heal when projectile hits mob.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant21: Multishot: Chance to shoot several projectiles.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant22: Piercing: Chance to pass through entities.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant24: Projectile Protection: Chance to destroy nearby projectiles.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant25: Protection: Chance to gain protection effect when projectile hits mob.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant28: Respiration: Restore air when projectile hits mob.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant29: Riptide: Launch player towards projectile impact.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant3: Blast Protection: Chance to explode upon projectile contact.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant31: Silk Touch: Small chance to drop spawn egg when projectile kills mob.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant32: Smite: Increase damage against undead mobs.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant34: Sweeping Edge: AoE damage at projectile impact.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant35: Thorns: Chance to apply poison when projectile hits mob.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant36: Unbreaking: Chance to ignore armor when projectile hits mob.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant4: Channeling: Chance to create lightning upon projectile contact.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant5: Depth Strider: Increase underwater projectile speed.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant6: Efficiency: Increase damage based on distance travelled.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant7: Feather Falling: Chance to apply levitation on projectile hit.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant8: Fire Aspect: Chance to apply fire on projectile hit.
gui.runesword.magic.sword.minorenchant9: Fire Protection: Projectile leaves trail of fire.
gui.runesword.magic.text: The magic rune is a special rune, that has an active effect instead of a passive effect. Right-clicking a sword or axe with a magic rune equipped in the major slot will create a magic effect. The power of the effect can be boosted by equipping the sword or axe with minor magic runes.
gui.runesword.runeforge1: The runeforge is the block used to insert runes into swords and axes. Here is how you craft it:
gui.runesword.runeforge2: And here is the runeforge GUI:
gui.runesword.runeforge3: You start by inserting a sword or axe into the middle slot (1). You can then insert runes into the sword/axe by placing them in slot 2-5. The higher the quality of the sword/axe, the more runes can be inserted. For example, a stone tool only has the first rune slot unlocked (2), while a netherite tool has all four rune slots unlocked.
gui.runesword.runeforge4: The rune slots 2-4 are minor rune slots, while the top slot (5) is a major rune slot. Runes in the minor slots will have a smaller effect, while the rune in the major slot will have a big effect.
gui.runesword.water.obtain: Obtain: Found in treasure chests under water.
gui.runesword.water.sword.major: Major: The sword deals more damage while under water.
gui.runesword.water.sword.majorenchant1: Aqua Affinity: Major effect also in rain.
gui.runesword.water.sword.majorenchant3: Protection: Take reduced damage in water.
gui.runesword.water.sword.minorenchant2: Luck of the Sea: Chance to ignore drowning.
